alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Cave Creek, New River; Deer Valley; Dripping Springs; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Globe, Miami; Mazatzal Mountains; New River Mesa; Northwest Valley; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Rio Verde, Salt River; San Carlos; Southeast Gila County; Superior; Tonto Basin (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 12 at 2:05AM MST until September 12 at 8:30AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following areas, Pinal/Superstition Mountains, Globe/Miami, Dripping Springs, Mazatzal Mountains, San Carlos, Southeast Gila County, Superior, Tonto Basin, Apache Junction/Gold Canyon, Cave Creek/New River, Northwest Valley, Deer Valley, Fountain Hills/East Mesa, and North Scottsdale, * WHEN...From 11 AM MST this morning through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of normally dry washes, streets, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Unbridged crossings may get flooded out. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms are anticipated to develop over portions of south-central Arizona during the day Monday and produce locally heavy rainfall and in turn create the potential for flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. When encountering a flooded roadway, Turn Around, Don`t Drown.
